kizuna_history_d_01:
[VAR BD06(0000)][VAR TRNAME(0000)]! Did you find any of
the\r
treasures\r
of ruin?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_02:
I hope you will investigate the shrines if you are
at all inclined to do so.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_03:
Hm? It seems to me that you don’t have anything
new to report on the treasures of ruin...[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_04a: Oh! You caught Ting-Lu, the Vessel of Ruin?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_04b: Oh! You caught Chien-Pao, the Sword of Ruin?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_04c: Oh! You caught Wo-Chien, the Tablets of Ruin?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_04d: Oh! You caught Chi-Yu, the Beads of Ruin?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_05:
Ohohooo! How interesting! I simply cannot keep
my curiosity under control![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_06a:
Judging by its shape and size, this vessel was
almost certainly NOT for everyday use.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_07a:
Perhaps it was a work of art? Or, better yet, a
ritual artifact housing some sort of deity?![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_08a:
I feel that there must be some meaning behind
the horns and the designs resembling eyes.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_09a:
Could it be that this artifact was fashioned after
the deity’s very appearance?![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_06b:
So the sword’s blade and hilt form the Pokémon’s
left and right fangs![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_07b:
I wonder if the sword broke when it became a
Pokémon... Or perhaps it was always that way?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_08b:
No, wait—I cannot imagine the king wanting to
buy a broken sword.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_09b:
Maybe it was some sort of weapon that was
meant to be used in this “broken” state?![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_06c:
I’ve never seen so many wooden writing tablets
strung together! It must have been an epic tale![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_07c:
Most excavated tablets are tantamount to graffiti
or simple memos—still valuable tools for learning\r
about the past, but nothing like this![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_08c:
I can’t read it, but given the length...it must be
a story, yes! Or perhaps the words of a curse...?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_09c:
If only the words weren’t faded! How frustrating!
These wooden tablets piqued the curiosity of a\r
king! What might have been written on them?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_06d:
Beads like these were thought to be sacred and
thus were worn during religious rituals.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_07d:
I believe they were most often worn as a single
bead on the neck like a pendant, but it seems\r
Chi-Yu has four of them.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_08d:
Were the beads worn in pairs, like on the ears
and wrists? Or were the rituals perhaps\r
performed by four people?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_09d:
What on earth could have caused beads such as
these—originally used to ward off disaster—to\r
become bringers of disaster themselves?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_10:
This mystery grows ever deeper. Ah! My thirst
for knowledge is slowly being quenched![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_11:
Hm? You look like you have something more to
report. What is it?[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_12:
Seeing part of history with my own eyes fills me
with joy. I thank you, [VAR TRNAME(0000)].[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_13:
Please come back and report to me again if you
find more of the treasures of ruin.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_14:
This is simply amazing. You have now reported
back to me with all four of the treasures of ruin.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_15:
I never thought that you would be able to do
THIS much for me.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_17:
I would have liked to go looking for the treasures
of ruin myself and make them my own.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_18:
But I suppose it was precisely because I sent
you—someone with a pure heart—that we were\r
able to accomplish this feat.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_19:
They may be the treasures of my dreams, but I
will allow you to have them for now.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_20:
Consider this a symbol of my gratitude, too.
Take it. It is yours.[VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_21:
[VAR BD06(0000)]Heh. You truly are an interesting one, aren’t
you, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]? I hope you\r
don’t\r
mind\r
if\r
I\r
continue\r
to\r
keep an eye on you![VAR 0114(0027)]
kizuna_history_d_system_01: You formed a close bond with Ms. Raifort!
